The article clearly details the survival benefit of eribulin, but it fails to tell readers that the drug has been approved in the United States. It also fell short because it did not explain how much the drug costs or how often harms occurred in the study. Metastatic breast cancer becomes progressively more difficult to treat as various therapies become less effective. This study suggests that eribulin is the first single-agent chemotherapy that extended the survival time of women with metastatic breast cancer who had already been treated with two to five other chemotherapies. This study is likely to generate significant interest and may change clinical practice for metastatic patients.

As our medical editor on this review wrote, “Low T syndrome reflects a cure in search of a disease.” The column was solid for what it did – teasing for what more it could have done. What does “feeling manly” mean? What does “virility” mean? Does a 1% per year decline in testosterone levels for most men mean they have a condition that requires treatment? There are conditions attributable to low testosterone that warrant treatment. This story – although it rated well – could have done a better job addressing such questions.

We find that Cheney played a key role in de-Baathification and in creating the circumstances thatled to the formation of ISIS. Former Baathists provide important military ISIS leadership, as they did in the first few years after the invasion when they joined forces with the group that preceded ISIS, al-Qaida in Iraq. However, many of those same Baathists later turned against al-Qaida in Iraq. They shifted back into the orbit of what became ISIS due to the repressive policies under Iraqi Prime Minister Maliki. The causal link is too distant to say Cheney created ISIS. His decisions contributed to the groups formation, but not more than that.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these is a function of a leaf? (A) Carrying nutrients throughout the plant (B) Converting solar energy into sugar (C) Creating shade for the plant (D) Absorbing water from the ground The answer is (B) Converting solar energy into sugar.
This is a science exam question and answer. Earth makes a complete revolution around the Sun about once every (A) day (B) year (C) season (D) minute The answer is (B) year.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which item is designed to change electrical energy into heat energy? (A) Alarm clock (B) Hand dryer (C) Fan (D) Telephone The answer is (B) Hand dryer.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these is most likely harmful to an ecosystem? (A) Building new homes in a wetland (B) Taking away airplanes from an airport (C) Planting trees in an orchard (D) Adding floors to an office building The answer is (A) Building new homes in a wetland.

This is a science exam question and answer. Tony is studying ladybugs in a garden. Which of these would BEST help Tony to count the spots on a ladybug? (A) Stopwatch (B) Thermometer (C) Measuring cup (D) Magnifying glass The answer is (D) Magnifying glass.

This is a science exam question and answer. A paper bag is ripped into pieces. Which of these BEST describes the pieces of the bag? (A) Stronger than the whole bag (B) Thicker than the whole bag (C) Smaller than the whole bag (D) Darker than the whole bag The answer is (C) Smaller than the whole bag.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of the following is the best observation of the refraction of light? (A) Looking at oneself in a mirror (B) Looking at a shadow of an object (C) Viewing an object through an open window (D) Viewing an object partially in water The answer is (D) Viewing an object partially in water.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which part of a bicycle BEST moves in a circle? (A) Seat (B) Frame (C) Foot pedal (D) Kickstand The answer is (C) Foot pedal.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these activities is most likely to have a positive impact on the environment of Earth? (A) Expanding neighborhoods (B) Building factories (C) Constructing highways (D) Creating nature preserves The answer is (D) Creating nature preserves.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these is a nonliving part of a forest? (A) Tree (B) Soil (C) Worm (D) Mushroom The answer is (B) Soil.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these human activities most relies on high-quality soil? (A) Hiking (B) Hunting (C) Coal mining (D) Growing crops The answer is (D) Growing crops.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which part of a plant cell is responsible for controlling the activities of the other parts of the cell? (A) Vacuole (B) Nucleus (C) Cell wall (D) Chloroplast The answer is (B) Nucleus.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these can be mined from Earth and used as an energy source? (A) Coal (B) Gravel (C) Granite (D) Limestone The answer is (A) Coal.
This is a science exam question and answer. Mold is often found growing on old bread. In a food chain, mold is a (A) decomposer (B) producer (C) consumer (D) scavenger The answer is (A) decomposer.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these human activities most relies on high-quality soil? (A) Hiking (B) Hunting (C) Coal mining (D) Growing crops The answer is (D) Growing crops.

This is a science exam question and answer. Max is doing an experiment on tomato plants. His hypothesis is, "A tomato plant will not grow in a shady area."� On which of these relationships did Max base his hypothesis? (A) Warm temperature causes plant growth. (B) Sunlight causes plant growth. (C) Tall plants cause shade. (D) New plants need fresh water. The answer is (B) Sunlight causes plant growth..
This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these BEST describes the way a feather feels? (A) Colorful (B) Soft (C) Low (D) Bright The answer is (B) Soft.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which causes the GREATEST change in a grassy field over time? (A) The time of day (B) Amount of yearly rainfall (C) Number of birds nesting (D) Seasonal migration of animals The answer is (B) Amount of yearly rainfall.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these is the main function of a cell wall? (A) To make food (B) To store water (C) To provide support (D) To make the plant green The answer is (C) To provide support.

This is a science exam question and answer. People can help keep a forest a good place for birds to live by (A) dumping garbage in a small part of the forest (B) building a road through the middle of the forest (C) burning dead trees to make smoke in the air (D) preventing too many trees from being cut down The answer is (D) preventing too many trees from being cut down.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these is a way the people of Virginia can help restore a natural ecosystem? (A) Burn their trash (B) Plant native plants (C) Feed leftover meals to deer (D) Drain automobile oil into the grass The answer is (B) Plant native plants.

This is a science exam question and answer. Early scientists most likely saw a discharge of electricity for the first time when observing a (A) waterfall (B) rainbow (C) lightning storm (D) volcano erupting The answer is (C) lightning storm.

This is a science exam question and answer. A company plants trees on a bare hillside. Which of these is the BEST reason for planting the trees? (A) The trees provide oxygen for the soil. (B) The trees prevent soil from washing away. (C) The trees make shade for animals living there. (D) The trees cause animals to move to other places. The answer is (B) The trees prevent soil from washing away..

Matthews said Cheney de-Baathisized the Iraqi government and created ISIS. We find that Cheney played a key role in de-Baathification and in creating the circumstances thatled to the formation of ISIS. Former Baathists provide important military ISIS leadership, as they did in the first few years after the invasion when they joined forces with the group that preceded ISIS, al-Qaida in Iraq. However, many of those same Baathists later turned against al-Qaida in Iraq. They shifted back into the orbit of what became ISIS due to the repressive policies under Iraqi Prime Minister Maliki. The causal link is too distant to say Cheney created ISIS. His decisions contributed to the groups formation, but not more than that.

pubhealth:
What's true: Native American activist Nathan Phillips said he served in the U.S. Army and told news outlets that he was a ""vietnam-era"" veteran. What's false: Nathan Phillips was not deployed to Vietnam at any time during his military service.
The vast majority of heroin in the United States comes from Mexico and South America.
Bayer AG had hoped a new trial strategy focusing jurors on scientific evidence could stem a burgeoning tide of U.S. lawsuits over its glyphosate-based weed killer roundup, but a second jury finding on Tuesday that the product caused cancer has narrowed the company’s options, some legal experts said.
Michele Bachmann claims Republicans have no health care alternative.
What's true: Native American activist Nathan Phillips said he served in the U.S.  Marine Corps Reserve. What's false: Contrary to what multiple news reports initially stated, Phillips was not deployed to Vietnam at any time during his military service.
What's true: Queen Elizabeth II wore a Burmese Ruby Tiara while meeting President Donald Trump in June 2019 the 96 rubies that adorn the crown of this tiara are said to symbolically protect the wearer from 96 diseases. What's false: No evidence exists that the Queen specifically chose this tiara as a slight against Trump, and the Queen has worn this same tiara on several other occasions and in the company of a wide range of world leaders.
Just over a third of U.S. adults ages 18 to 65 got the flu shot during the 2012-2013 flu season, according to an analysis released on Tuesday, and if that trend holds for the current flu season, many adults may be at risk.
The World Health Organization and the U.S. U.S. CDC found that mild cases account for 75-to-80% of all cases and do not require hospitalization.
Factoring that in the increase was around £370 million. This refers to the increase in spending by clinical commissioning groups, but doesn’t account for inflation. science_qa_task_sample: This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these is a function of a leaf? (A) Carrying nutrients throughout the plant (B) Converting solar energy into sugar (C) Creating shade for the plant (D) Absorbing water from the ground The answer is (B) Converting solar energy into sugar.
This is a science exam question and answer. Earth makes a complete revolution around the Sun about once every (A) day (B) year (C) season (D) minute The answer is (B) year.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which item is designed to change electrical energy into heat energy? (A) Alarm clock (B) Hand dryer (C) Fan (D) Telephone The answer is (B) Hand dryer.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these is most likely harmful to an ecosystem? (A) Building new homes in a wetland (B) Taking away airplanes from an airport (C) Planting trees in an orchard (D) Adding floors to an office building The answer is (A) Building new homes in a wetland.

This is a science exam question and answer. Tony is studying ladybugs in a garden. Which of these would BEST help Tony to count the spots on a ladybug? (A) Stopwatch (B) Thermometer (C) Measuring cup (D) Magnifying glass The answer is (D) Magnifying glass.

This is a science exam question and answer. A paper bag is ripped into pieces. Which of these BEST describes the pieces of the bag? (A) Stronger than the whole bag (B) Thicker than the whole bag (C) Smaller than the whole bag (D) Darker than the whole bag The answer is (C) Smaller than the whole bag.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of the following is the best observation of the refraction of light? (A) Looking at oneself in a mirror (B) Looking at a shadow of an object (C) Viewing an object through an open window (D) Viewing an object partially in water The answer is (D) Viewing an object partially in water.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which part of a bicycle BEST moves in a circle? (A) Seat (B) Frame (C) Foot pedal (D) Kickstand The answer is (C) Foot pedal.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these activities is most likely to have a positive impact on the environment of Earth? (A) Expanding neighborhoods (B) Building factories (C) Constructing highways (D) Creating nature preserves The answer is (D) Creating nature preserves.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which part of a plant cell is responsible for controlling the activities of the other parts of the cell? (A) Vacuole (B) Nucleus (C) Cell wall (D) Chloroplast The answer is (B) Nucleus.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which part of a bicycle BEST moves in a circle? (A) Seat (B) Frame (C) Foot pedal (D) Kickstand The answer is (C) Foot pedal.

This is a science exam question and answer. Pumice is formed when lava from a volcano cools. Which rock type is pumice? (A) Gaseous rock (B) Igneous rock (C) Sedimentary rock (D) Metamorphic rock The answer is (B) Igneous rock.

This is a science exam question and answer. Early scientists most likely saw a discharge of electricity for the first time when observing a (A) waterfall (B) rainbow (C) lightning storm (D) volcano erupting The answer is (C) lightning storm.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these describes water in a solid state? (A) Vapor rising in the sky (B) Hail during a storm (C) Waves crashing on the seashore (D) Rain falling from the clouds The answer is (B) Hail during a storm.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these human activities most relies on high-quality soil? (A) Hiking (B) Hunting (C) Coal mining (D) Growing crops The answer is (D) Growing crops.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these is a function of a leaf? (A) Carrying nutrients throughout the plant (B) Converting solar energy into sugar (C) Creating shade for the plant (D) Absorbing water from the ground The answer is (B) Converting solar energy into sugar.

This is a science exam question and answer. Pumice is formed when lava from a volcano cools. Which rock type is pumice? (A) Gaseous rock (B) Igneous rock (C) Sedimentary rock (D) Metamorphic rock The answer is (B) Igneous rock.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these is a nonliving part of a forest? (A) Tree (B) Soil (C) Worm (D) Mushroom The answer is (B) Soil.

This is a science exam question and answer. How are a tree and grass alike? (A) Both make wood. (B) Both have roots. (C) Both need moonlight. (D) Both have short lives. The answer is (B) Both have roots..

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these describes water in a solid state? (A) Vapor rising in the sky (B) Hail during a storm (C) Waves crashing on the seashore (D) Rain falling from the clouds The answer is (B) Hail during a storm.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which part of a bicycle BEST moves in a circle? (A) Seat (B) Frame (C) Foot pedal (D) Kickstand The answer is (C) Foot pedal.

This is a science exam question and answer. A paper bag is ripped into pieces. Which of these BEST describes the pieces of the bag? (A) Stronger than the whole bag (B) Thicker than the whole bag (C) Smaller than the whole bag (D) Darker than the whole bag The answer is (C) Smaller than the whole bag.

This is a science exam question and answer. A company plants trees on a bare hillside. Which of these is the BEST reason for planting the trees? (A) The trees provide oxygen for the soil. (B) The trees prevent soil from washing away. (C) The trees make shade for animals living there. (D) The trees cause animals to move to other places. The answer is (B) The trees prevent soil from washing away..
This is a science exam question and answer. Which of these human activities most relies on high-quality soil? (A) Hiking (B) Hunting (C) Coal mining (D) Growing crops The answer is (D) Growing crops.
This is a science exam question and answer. Which structure surrounds and protects an animal cell? (A) Nucleus (B) Vacuole (C) Cytoplasm (D) Cell membrane The answer is (D) Cell membrane.

This is a science exam question and answer. Which of the following is the best observation of the refraction of light? (A) Looking at oneself in a mirror (B) Looking at a shadow of an object (C) Viewing an object through an open window (D) Viewing an object partially in water The answer is (D) Viewing an object partially in water.
